title: How to Sync Your Facebook Account & Contacts on Android

steps.title: Open Facebook.
steps.content: Open Facebook. This app features a lowercase blue "f" on a white background. This is helpful if you skipped the step that allows Facebook and Android to sync your contacts when setting up your profile.

steps.title: Tap your profile icon.
steps.content: Tap your profile icon. It’s in the upper-right corner of the Facebook Android app. This opens your profile menu.

steps.title: Tap the gear icon.
steps.content: Tap the gear icon. You should see this Settings icon in the top-right corner of the menu. Alternatively, tap Settings & Privacy at the bottom of the menu, then tap Settings . [1] X Research source

steps.title: Tap Account Center.
steps.content: Tap Account Center . It’s the large box at the top of the page. This opens the Meta Account Center.

steps.title: Tap Your information and permissions.
steps.content: Tap Your information and permissions . It’s about halfway down the Account Center page below the “Account settings” page.

steps.title: Tap Upload contacts.
steps.content: Tap Upload contacts . It’s the last option at the bottom of the page. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Tap your Facebook account.
steps.content: Tap your Facebook account. If you are signed into multiple Meta accounts (i.e. Instagram or Threads), you’ll need to tap your Facebook account. It has your profile picture with the Facebook icon next to it.

steps.title: Tap the switch next to "Upload contacts" to toggle it on .
steps.content: Tap the switch next to "Upload contacts" to toggle it on . The switch should be to the right if it's on. When this is enabled, Facebook will automatically upload contacts from your Android every time you use the Facebook app. [3] X Research source Disabling this will also erase any previous contact data. If you want to delete your contacts, you'll need to turn this feature off, then go to your contact management page and select Delete All . If you have "Upload contacts" enabled, all the deleted contacts will be restored from your mobile.

steps.title: Go to Settings.
steps.content: Go to Settings. To do this, swipe down from the top of your screen to open the Quick Settings menu. Then tap the Gear icon in the upper-right corner. [4] X Research source You should only be using this method if using Facebook did not work for you, as the other way is the official method of syncing contacts.

steps.title: Tap Accounts and Backup.
steps.content: Tap Accounts and Backup . The wording may vary slightly depending on your phone's manufacturer. Instead, this menu could say "Accounts & Sync." [5] X Research source You may need to tap Manage accounts to see all your active accounts and continue.

steps.title: Tap on your Facebook account.
steps.content: Tap on your Facebook account. It’ll be next to the Facebook logo. You must have a Facebook account to be able to see this option. If you don't see Facebook in the list of accounts, add it. Tap Add account at the bottom of your screen, then tap Facebook from the list. Enter your Facebook account information (like your email and password), then tap Sync Now when prompted.

steps.title: Tap Sync account.
steps.content: Tap Sync account . This will direct you to another window with your Facebook account information.

steps.title: Tap ⋮.
steps.content: Tap ⋮ . You'll see this three-dot menu icon in the top-right corner of your screen. [6] X Research source

steps.title: Tap Sync now.
steps.content: Tap Sync now . Depending on your Internet speed and the number of contacts synced, this might take a few seconds, so wait for a little while. [7] X Research source Check your contacts. If you see the Facebook icon beside your contacts, then you have successfully synced your Facebook account to your Android device.

steps.title: Open Facebook.
steps.content: Open Facebook. This app features a lowercase blue "f" on a white background. This is helpful if you want to sync your Facebook account with your Instagram or Threads account.

steps.title: Tap your profile icon.
steps.content: Tap your profile icon. It’s in the upper-right corner of the Android app. This opens your profile menu.

steps.title: Tap the gear icon.
steps.content: Tap the gear icon. You should see this Settings icon in the top-right corner of the menu. Alternatively, tap Settings & Privacy at the bottom of the menu, then tap Settings . [8] X Research source

steps.title: Tap Account Center.
steps.content: Tap Account Center . It’s the large box at the top of the page. This opens the Meta account center.

steps.title: Tap Sharing across profiles.
steps.content: Tap Sharing across profiles . It’s the first option below “Connected experiences” at the top.

steps.title: Tap your Facebook account.
steps.content: Tap your Facebook account. It’s the first option below “Share from” at the top of the page. If you don’t see your Instagram or Threads account, tap Add account at the bottom and follow the prompts to connect your Instagram account .

steps.title: Tap the toggle switch next to the items you want to share.
steps.content: Tap the toggle switch next to the items you want to share. On Instagram, you can share your Facebook stories, posts, and reels. On Threads, you can share your Facebook posts. [9] X Research source
